title: Investigative Activities as Scientific Practices: Instructional Design Linking the Phenomenon-Data-Explanation Model

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: A process designed to help practicing elementary school teachers systematically plan and instruct science inquiry activities in actual classrooms, offering a flexible learning environment through digital device-based microlearning.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze the interconnected structure between phenomena-data-explanation models in the scientific inquiry process.
Learners can scientifically interpret inquiry data using mathematical tools (graphs, tables, statistics).
Learners can present three or more inquiry activity design frameworks applicable to real classroom environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
